labels.analysis: The Onyx MCP Server enhances semantic search and chat capabilities by connecting MCP-compatible clients to Onyx AI knowledge bases. It enables seamless retrieval of relevant context from documents, supporting powerful interactions and comprehensive answers. This server streamlines knowledge management and improves information access across organizations, primarily through its search and chat tools.
labels.reasoning: The primary functionality revolves around semantic search and knowledge retrieval, making "Web Search & Research" the most fitting primary label. The chat capability also aligns with broader knowledge management and contextual information access. While "AI/ML Tools" and "Memory Management" could be relevant, they are secondary to the core search functionality. No custom label is required as the predefined labels sufficiently categorize the server.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@lupuletic/onyx-mcp-server/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())

smithery_configuration_requirements.name: onyxApiToken
smithery_configuration_requirements.description: Onyx API token for accessing the Onyx API.
